required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Recombinant Human Angiotensin-converting Enzyme 2 (rhACE2) as a Treatment for Patients With COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Recombinant Human Angiotensin-converting Enzyme 2 (rhACE2) as a Treatment for Patients With COVID-19

brief_summary.textblock: Recombinant human angotensin-converting enzyme 2 (rhACE2) as a treatment for patients with COVID-19 to block viral entry and decrease viral replication.

primary_outcome.measure: All Cause-death or Invasive Mechanical Ventilation
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint was a composite endpoint of all cause-death or invasive mechanical ventilation up to 28 days or hospital discharge.

secondary_outcome.description: Log transformed levels of LDH at Day 5 as a surrogate marker for organ damage (powered secondary endpoint).

VFD up to 28 days or hospital discharge. VFD and mechanical-VFD (mVFD) were calculated as time in the study minus duration of ventilation and were set to zero if the duration of ventilation exceeded the time in the study. Three analysis approaches were used: 1) Death not censored: (m)VFD was set to zero for patients who died. 2) Death censored: patients who died before or on Day 28 were censored at the day before death. 3) Alive patients analyzed: only patients who were alive at Day 28, hospital discharge, or early termination were included in the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Responders, Defined as ≥2 Improvement in World Health Organization (WHO)'s 11-Point Score System at Days 7, 10, 14 and 28

secondary_outcome.description: The number of days from randomization to discharge from hospital was calculated (Kaplan-Meier analysis). Patients without hospitalization or without documented hospital discharge who completed the study or were early terminated before Day 28 were censored at the date of study completion or discontinuation, respectively. Patients who died before Day 28 were censored at the date of death even if early terminated before.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 3, Day 5, Day 7, Day 14, and Day 28/End of study (EOS)
secondary_outcome.description: Viral RNA was assessed in blood samples using quantitative reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) and projected to RNA copies per mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to a 2-point Decrease in WHO's 11-Point Score System
Number of Patients With Any Use of Invasive Mechanical Ventilation up to 28 Days or Hospital Discharge
secondary_outcome.description: The number of patients receiving mechanical ventilation and supplemental oxygen was evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Use of Invasive Mechanical Ventilation up to 28 Days or Hospital Discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomization to first use of invasive mechanical ventilation was calculated (Kaplan-Meier analysis). Patients without documented invasive mechanical ventilation who completed the study, were early terminated or discharged from hospital before Day 28 were censored at the date of study completion, discontinuation or discharge from hospital, respectively.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 7, Day 10, Day 14, and Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: The ratio in partial pressure of arterial oxygen (PaO2)/fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2) was assessed by analysis of patient's blood gas.

secondary_outcome.measure: Modified Sequential Organ Failure Assessment Score (mSOFA Score, Total Score)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -1 (Screening), Day 7, Day 10, Day 14, Day 28/End of study
secondary_outcome.description: The mSOFA score predicts intensive care unit mortality using clinical and laboratory variables. 5 organ systems (respiratory SpO2/FiO2; liver; cardiovascular/hypotension; Central nervous System/Glasgow Coma Score; renal/creatinine), all, except for liver, scored on a 0 to 4 scale (liver: 2-point scale: 0 or 3) according to specified criteria indicating severity, with the total score ranging from 0 to a maximum score of 19. A higher score reflects a worse disease state.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -1, Day 3, Day 7, Day 10, Day 14, Day 28/End of study
secondary_outcome.description: Lymphocytes were assessed in blood samples from the patients.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -1, Day 3, Day 7, Day 10, Day 14, Day 28/End of study
secondary_outcome.description: C-reactive protein was assessed in blood samples from the patients.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -1, Day 3, Day 7, Day 10, Day 14, Day 28/End of study
secondary_outcome.description: D-Dimer was assessed in blood samples from the patients.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day -1, Day 3, Day 7, Day 10, Day 14, Day 28/End of study
secondary_outcome.description: Log transformed levels of LDH in blood were assessed as a surrogate marker for organ damage.

intervention.description: Patients will be treated with APN01 intravenously twice daily (BID).
Patients will be treated with placebo intravenously twice daily (BID).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Hospitalized male or female
2. Diagnosed to be COVID-19 POSITIV
3. Signed Inform Consent Form
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any patient whose clinical condition is deteriorating rapidly
2. Known history of positive Hepatitis B surface antigen, Hepatitis C antibody or HIV antibody
3. History of sensitivity to any of the study medications, or components thereof or a history of drug or other allergy that, in the opinion of the investigator or Medical Monitor, contraindicates their participation
4. Pregnant females as determined by positive serum or urine hCG test prior to dosing
5. Lung transplantation
6. Pre-existing renal failure, i.e. requiring renal replacement therapy with hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis
7. There are other uncontrolled co-morbidities that increase the risks associated with the study drug administration, that are assessed by the medical expert team as unsuitable
8. Patient in clinical trials for COVID-19 within 30 days before ICF
9. Immunocompromised patients (chemotherapy, HIV, organ transplants, stem cell transplants)

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 185 Patients were screened of whom 181 patients were randomized.

group.title: Group A (Active) APN01
group.description: Patients were treated with APN01 (Recombinant human angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 [rhACE2]) intravenously twice daily (BID).

group.title: Group B (Placebo Control)
group.description: Patients were treated with placebo (physiological saline solution) intravenously twice daily (BID).

baseline.population: All randomized patients who received at least 1 dose of investigational medicinal product (IMP).

outcome.title: All Cause-death or Invasive Mechanical Ventilation
outcome.description: The primary endpoint was a composite endpoint of all cause-death or invasive mechanical ventilation up to 28 days or hospital discharge.
outcome.population: All randomized patients who had received at least 1 dose of investigational medicinal product (IMP).

group.title: Group A (Active) APN01
group.description: Patients were treated with APN01 (Recombinant human angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 [rhACE2]) intravenously twice daily (BID).

group.title: Group B (Placebo Control)
group.description: Patients were treated with placebo (physiological saline solution) intravenously twice daily (BID).

measure.title: All Cause-death or Invasive Mechanical Ventilation
measure.description: The primary endpoint was a composite endpoint of all cause-death or invasive mechanical ventilation up to 28 days or hospital discharge.
measure.population: All randomized patients who had received at least 1 dose of investigational medicinal product (IMP).

analysis.groups_desc: Hypothesis tested: H0: pAPN01 = pPlacebo; H1: pAPN01 ≠ pPlacebo (with p=proportion of patients with event). A total of 186 patients (93 per group) was estimated to yield 80% power to detect a 20% absolute risk reduction in the primary, from 50% in the placebo group to 30% in the APN01 group, at a 2-sided alpha of 0.05. To consider patients who would be randomized but not treated, a total of 200 patients (100 per group) were planned to be enrolled.

outcome.title: Lactate Dehydrogenase (LDH) Level
outcome.description: Log transformed levels of LDH at Day 5 as a surrogate marker for organ damage (powered secondary endpoint).
outcome.population: All randomized patients who had received at least 1 dose of IMP and had an LDH measurement at Day 5.

measure.title: Mortality

outcome.title: Ventilator-free Days (VFD)
outcome.description: VFD up to 28 days or hospital discharge. VFD and mechanical-VFD (mVFD) were calculated as time in the study minus duration of ventilation and were set to zero if the duration of ventilation exceeded the time in the study. Three analysis approaches were used: 1) Death not censored: (m)VFD was set to zero for patients who died. 2) Death censored: patients who died before or on Day 28 were censored at the day before death. 3) Alive patients analyzed: only patients who were alive at Day 28, hospital discharge, or early termination were included in the analysis.
outcome.population: All randomized patients who had received at least 1 dose of IMP. In addition, a subgroup analysis was performed including only patients who were still alive at Day 28 (or discharged from the hospital/early terminated).

group.title: Group A (Active) APN01
group.description: Patients were treated with APN01 (Recombinant human angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 [rhACE2]) intravenously twice daily (BID).

measure.population: All randomized patients who had received at least 1 dose of IMP. In addition, a subgroup analysis was performed including only patients who were still alive at Day 28 (or discharged from the hospital/early terminated).

measurement_list.measurement: Data of only 1 patient were available.

outcome.title: Modified Sequential Organ Failure Assessment Score (mSOFA Score, Total Score)
outcome.description: The mSOFA score predicts intensive care unit mortality using clinical and laboratory variables. 5 organ systems (respiratory SpO2/FiO2; liver; cardiovascular/hypotension; Central nervous System/Glasgow Coma Score; renal/creatinine), all, except for liver, scored on a 0 to 4 scale (liver: 2-point scale: 0 or 3) according to specified criteria indicating severity, with the total score ranging from 0 to a maximum score of 19. A higher score reflects a worse disease state.
outcome.time_frame: Day -1 (Screening), Day 7, Day 10, Day 14, Day 28/End of study
outcome.population: All randomized patients who had received at least 1 dose of IMP and who had a measurement of the mSOFA score at the respective timepoint.

A higher score reflects a worse disease state.
measure.population: All randomized patients who had received at least 1 dose of IMP and who had a measurement of the mSOFA score at the respective timepoint.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
